byline.contributor: Paulina Villegas and Azam Ahmed contributed reporting.
byline.original: By KIRK SEMPLE and ELISABETH MALKIN

abstract: International panel probing 2014 disappearance of 43 Mexican college students in Iguala, Mexico, score Mexican government's handling of case, asserting torture was used on five suspects; findings further undermine credibility of country's criminal justice system.

headline.print_headline: Panel Assails How Mexico Handled Case
headline.main: Inquiry Challenges Mexico’s Account of How 43 Students Vanished

snippet: Five suspects whose testimony underpinned the government’s conclusions gave confessions “under torture or cruel, inhumane or degrading treatment,” a report by international experts found.
lead_paragraph: Five suspects whose testimony underpinned the government’s conclusions gave confessions “under torture or cruel, inhumane or degrading treatment,” a report by international experts found.
